ARABIC: مَتَٰعٌ قَلِيلٌ ثُمَّ مَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: A brief enjoyment; then their shelter will be Hell. What an evil resting-place!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Their commerce is but short-lived, and then their abode shall be Hell: And what an evil abode!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is but a little enjoyment, then their destination is Hell -what an evil resting place!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Their gains are only a means of enjoyment in this life. However, their destination is hell, the terrible dwelling.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It is a brief usage; their home is hell; and what an evil resting-place!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A brief enjoyment; then their ultimate abode is Hell; and worst indeed is that place for rest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A brief enjoyment! then their abode is hell, and evil is the resting-place.

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [3:197] That is [but], a little enjoyment, which they enjoy for a short while in this world and then perishes; then their abode is Hell — an evil cradling, [an evil] resting place it is!
